definition: strip/item/article/clause (of law or treaty)/classifier for long thin things (ribbon, river, road, trousers etc)
see 拉皮條|拉皮条[la1 pi2 tiao2]

sentences.english: The stereotypical image of the pimp does not correspond with the different contexts for sex work.
sentences.chinese: 而皮條客的傳統形象與性工作的各種內容並不相符。

sentences.english: Soliciting a scarlet woman in China can be a serious crime.
sentences.chinese: 在中國大陸拉皮條，可能是重罪。

sentences.english: Golf is a sport for white men dressed like black pimps.
sentences.chinese: 高爾夫是穿得像黑人皮條客的白人的運動。

sentences.english: He became well known for pandering to any man who needed a woman.
sentences.chinese: 他以給人拉皮條而臭名昭著。

sentences.english: For many years David lived an evil life, pandering to men's sexual's desires.
sentences.chinese: 多年來大衛一直過着邪惡的生活，爲男人拉皮條。

sentences.english: Shoes man's shoes for the cloth tied at the end of sodium, shoes, face inlaid double thong.
sentences.chinese: 男人的鞋爲布底納綁，鞋臉鑲嵌雙皮條。

sentences.english: Indeed, why not the patrons and the pimps?
sentences.chinese: 說真的，爲什麼老鴇和皮條客沒有遊街呢？

sentences.english: When she was 10, a 31-year-old pimp promised he would take care of her.
sentences.chinese: 10歲那年，一個31歲的皮條客發誓要好好照顧她。

sentences.english: Why do you think women are with pimps?
sentences.chinese: 你覺得爲什麼女人會和皮條客在一起？

sentences.english: And I am not pimping you out.
Epidermis bioassay was conducted 2 weeks after the treatment.
sentences.chinese: 兩週後，撕去葉表皮條進行氣孔格局分析。

sentences.english: Often seen in the company of pimps and hustlers.
sentences.chinese: 經常可以在有皮條客和嫖客的地方看到他們。

sentences.english: Kill more chinks, free thai women pimped by chinese men.
sentences.chinese: 多殺點中國佬，解放被中國男人拉皮條的泰國女人。

sentences.english: But I really and honestly feel that we're pandering.
sentences.chinese: 但我真的覺得我們像是拉皮條的。

sentences.english: Explore the psychedelic world and dress like a "pimp" to access the hidden stage.
sentences.chinese: 探索迷幻的世界，像“皮條客”服飾訪問隱藏的階段。

sentences.english: Many of the women are controlled by pimps .
sentences.chinese: 許多這樣的女人由皮條客控制。

definition: lit. 300 silver taels not hidden here (idiom); fig. to reveal what one intends to hide
pinyin: ci3 di4 wu2 yin2 san1 bai3 liang3

definition: bring it on!/give me all you got!
to drown sb in a wicker basket, a form of 沉潭[chen2 tan2]
lit. rarely seen, very strange (idiom); to express amazement due to lack of experience/naive expression of excitement due to ignorance
see the opportunity and act (idiom); to act according to circumstances/to play it by ear/to use one's discretion
(slang) to target an intoxicated person for sexual assault
to go around in circles/to make a detour/(fig.) to beat about the bush
A rabbit doesn't eat the grass by its own burrow (idiom); One shouldn't do anything to harm one's neighbors.
pinyin: tu4 zi5 bu4 chi1 wo1 bian1 cao3

definition: lit. to give medicine to a dead horse (idiom)/fig. to keep trying everything in a desperate situation
pinyin: si3 ma3 dang4 huo2 ma3 yi1
